name: 張國楨　Office Hours
objective:
To understand slope hazards, including general mechanics, natural factors, human factors, unique conditions in Taiwan, and then discuss the principles and methods of preventing slope hazards.
1. The importance of preventing and controlling of slope disasters, 2. The general mechanics of slope disasters, 3. The relationship between erosion rate and landslides in Taiwan, 4. Taiwan's most vulnerable slope, 5. Natural dynamics of Taiwan's slope disasters 6. Man-made slope hazard factors, 7. Precursors of slope damage, 8. General principles of slope disaster prevention and control, 9. Basic information on slope disaster prevention and treatment, 10. Slope disaster prevention and recovery technology, 11. Slope disaster prevention emergency treatment methods 12 Slope disaster prevention case analysis.
schedule:
1-3 Type of Landslides
4-5 Slope failure mechanism
6-7 Landslide hazard and risk assessment
8-9 Organization of Investigation process
10-11 Slope instability recognition, analysis and zonation
12-13 surface observation and geologic mapping
15-16 subsurface exploration
17-18 Field instrumentation
materials:
1. Landslides investigation and mitigation, special report 247, Transportation research board, National Research Council. National Academy Press
2. Natural and Artificial Rockslide Dams, Stephen G. Evans et al., Springer
